headline: Classic Goulash
description: This goulash recipe is made on the stovetop with ground beef, tomatoes, herbs, and mararoni for a classic one-pot meal the whole family will enjoy.
name: Classic Goulash
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon seasoned salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 3 minutes, stirring often. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up the meat until it is evenly browned, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 3 minutes, stirring often.
Stir in water, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, soy sauce, Italian seasoning, seasoned salt, and bay leaves. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook 5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Stir in uncooked macaroni, cover, and simmer over medium heat until pasta is tender, 11 to 13 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat, discard bay leaves, and serve.

review.reviewBody: It was good just as written. If I make it again, I'll probably add a few more noodles and spice it a bit differently (a bit less salt, more heat). I did add diced green peppers to add a bit of texture. Everyone thought it was good, but not "great", so I'm not sure if I'll bother making it again or not. It's definitely hearty and great for busy, cold weekdays.
Used rotini instead of elbows. Great.
My recipe
This is easy to make and my family loves it! The flavor is really brought out by the bay leaves. I’ve made it with and without.

I made this for our family some time ago and the guys and myself loved it. Although my cans are slightly larger than your amounts, it has a little more liquid but it didn't stop them from having extra helpings. It was very much like what my father used to make when I was younger and it was so good! I now am making this about once every couple of weeks.
Excellent. Impresses guests every time.

There's a lot you can do with this, but it's completely delicious as-is. I would highly recommend ground turkey instead (it's healthier and not as fatty), more italian seasoning, and adding a green pepper (and mushrooms if you have them). I try to use beef or chicken broth instead of water. It makes plenty of leftovers that are easy to heat up at work.
LOVE THIS RECIPE ALSO, AND IT IS EASY.
Good basic recipe. You can modify to your liking for additional flavor and nutrition (such as adding beans). I will make this again.

Hearty and delicious. I added portabella mushrooms, red bell pepper and celery to the sauce. Doubled the amount of elbow macaroni. Swapped out the ground beef for Italian sausage, the soy sauce for Worchestershire and the diced tomatoes for Rotel tomatoes and green chilles. Will certainly make it again!
Really good and easy to make.
This was great. I added a lot more spice than called for, and a little bit of yellow pepper for color and sweetness. Use any random spices you like to your taste.
mine came out more soupy but that could be makers error
Made exactly as is and was great

I made it exactly as described without the bay leaves (we are not a fan). It is way too soupy and bland for us. I look forward to making it again without so much water and adding some zing like jalapenos or cayenne pepper.
Family favorite, it brings the kids home for dinner because they love it that much!
Lately I have not been eating a ton because simply I'm tired of the same old thing. But after giving this a try, I went back for thirds!! It was soooo good!!
Great recipe that makes it simple to substitute as desired. The very picky family loves it!

I just made this tonight, followed the recipe to a T, And it's DELISH!! I only added some shredded parm cheese at the end for serving. Everyone went back for seconds!! I will keep this recipe and make this many times again! A Winner for me🏆
Delicious and smells amazing!!

I used Classico pasta sauce instead of just regular tomato sauce. It comes in different flavors to choose from. I also add a can of tomato paste. I dont really measure anything, I just pour it in. I also use Rotel diced tomato and green chilies instead for a bit of a bite! Turns out great everytime!
I made it as the instructions required, very good dish, thank you.

I made it exactly as written because my wife’s version isn’t very flavorful and it was my turn to cook after work. It is very good and I’d do it again but would probably cut 1/2 cup of water (or simmer longer) to make it a tad thicker and add a tablespoon of paprika and a bell pepper.

Made this a couple times, first time i matched the recipe exact. I messed up and the noodles were mooshy. 2nd time I made it, I prepared the pasta separately. turned out amazing. next time I'm adding green pepper.
Too much salt taste. Next time, no soy, cut both season and regular salt. Everything else blended well and made for a delicious dinner.

I used different noodles, cavatappi. I also ran out of Worcestershire sauce so I had to mix up some soy sauce and ketchup to replace that. I only used 1 lb of burger as well, I am not a huge meat eater. End results came out perfect. The noodles were not overcooked and the taste was good. My husband enjoyed it and added jalapenos and shredded mozzarella. I just wish it was a little sweeter. I usually use tomato soup, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper for my seasoning and sauce, or occasionally tomato juice.
I added some fresh tomatoes 🍅 and green peppers 🫑 to the onion and garlic
Awesome recipe although, the salt was a bit too much, I feel like 1 teaspoon instead of 1 tablespoon, would be enough
It was very tastey, and easy to make.I made it as directed, but added 1 cp of cheese before serving.
liked.

So easy to make. Adjusted for one person.I used ground turkey instead. And reduced water to one cup since I was only using one pound of ground turkey. Hate bay leaves so left them out. Substituted Tamari for the soy sauce.Used smaller size of tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. Only used one teaspoon of salt, one teaspoon of Italian seasoning and one cup of elbow macaroni. Perfect. Double YUM.

I’ve made this for a few years. Great recipe, my family’s favorite. I tweak somewhat, nothing earth shattering, but add mushrooms, and green peppers, and go half and half with ground beef, and a spicy Italian sausage. Yum. It fantastic. Thank you.
It was amazing! I used bowtie noodles instead of elbow noodles...and i just wouldn't recommend. Stick with the recipe!
Awesome recipe! The flavors marry together nicely. My family asked that I enter this recipe into our rotation arsenal!
made it just as recipe stated. Loved it. Served with garlic bread.
Maybe add a little worchestershire sauce.

Dang that was good. Extremely easy to make. Comfort food at its best. I think just like the picture I should have added a little fresh parmesan(Not the cardboard stuff) and some scallions at the end. It was still amazing.

Very Good but too spicy. I made it as written the first time but everyone who ate it thought it had too much spice. The second time I cut the Italian seasoning down to 1/2 teaspoon and used a small bay leaf and it was perfect for us.

Pretty good stuff. My friend is currently on his second bowl. My only change was I cooked the onions first, then beef; adding garlic in the last few minutes. Also, less Italian seasoning. Just a personal thing. I look forward to making it again.
My kids just love this recipe!

While not the most exciting in taste, IMO it's a good base to start with if you're trying it for the first time and want a 'starter recipe' to build upon, like I do. In the next batch I'm browning/draining Italian sausage and adding a bit of smoked paprika to give it more flavor. Other than that, this is a super easy recipe, and makes a substantial batch that you can halve, freezing part for later.
It was really good. Did not add the salt. Added green pepper and celery and it was just like my mom's used to be. I will make again.
USED MORE TOMATO SAUCE !
Heart quick meal. Add a salad makes it perfect for those busy days. And my husband loved it.
I used dried crushed bay leaves from a spice bottle. It turned out good. I used one teaspoon of it. Will be making again.

Enjoyed this very much. I did cook my noodles separately, as I need to use gluten free, I undercooked them and combined and cooked together at the end and obviously reduced the water added. Next time I will experiment with timing & how much water to use for cooking gf pasta with the dish

I had never made goulash before and have used and enjoyed this recipe as is. After a few times I began to tweek it (I do to most recipes, dont we all) and it is just a great base to use for many things. Really enjoy it Thank you for posting it.
very good. Made and kept warm on stove while riding winter challenge miles . A&L too 1-2022
I used ground pork instead of ground beef. Tasted good!

My husband really liked it. He did say he’d like it a little “soupier.” Maybe a little more water or beef broth. However, I will add green pepper, Worcestershire instead of soy sauce (maybe) & less salt.

WE cut the water to 2.5 cups and used Worcestershire sauce instead of soy sauce. I also added diced green Bell pepper & 2 deseeded diced jalapeno peppers. My Mother added corn when we were children, but I didn't this time. As a child and the youngest of 11, this was a staple in our family. Now I make it for my wife and grandkids. An old family favorite revisited
My wife likes it.
Awesome recipe!! I used Rotels in place of the diced tomatoes for an extra kick! And Adobo spice in place of seasoning salt! Came out nice and spicy!!!
It is amazing. Love the flavors. Next time I will add rotel to spice it up a bit, other then that it is amazing.
We absolutely loved this recipe! I added mushrooms, red pepper, and corn and it's was *chef's kiss*

We liked this pretty well! The only thing I would change is that next time I would cut the amount of salt down to 1 1/2 teaspoons and I would whirl the diced tomatoes in the food processor for a few seconds to break them up a little bit. My husband doesn't like big chunks of tomato (picky guy that he is). Also, I wouldn't forget to add the minced garlic. D'oh! 

This recipe reminds me of the goulash that my mother used to make for us when I was growing up (I'm 61 years old now). Good memories!
I made this today for dinner as written and it is a keeper recipe. I cook for 4 of us ages 60 to 102 and everyone loved it and it's not easy to please everyone but this recipe did!!!
Made as recipe directed. LOVE this recipe! Great comfort food! So easy to throw together.
Made it just as it said. I will probably add some corn to it next time. Just to give it a little bit of texture.
Very good and flavorful. My picky eater nephew loves it. Cames out great, not soupy. I used radiatore pasta instead of elbow. Love it. We make it once a week.
Made this as described and it was really good. It's a staple now in our family. Just as a side note, you can add a chopped green bell pepper when you saute the onion and garlic. Adds some nice color.

I am making this for the second time now. The first time was so delicious, I couldn’t eat enough!! I made it exactly as the recipe states. Very easy to make with these ingredients that are usually always in your pantry. Thank you fir the goodness!
My family felt something was missing. After reading the other reviews I will try adding some extra ingredients when I make it next time.
Love this recipe. I add yellow and red bell peppers. Family loves it
Very good. However when I changed it down to 4 servings the recipe got skewed
I really liked this recipe. turned out great (will omit onions next time due the husband hating them) but other than that amazing!!!

I pretty much went by the recipe. However, I added some green pepper and used Worcestershire sauce in place of soy sauce as some comments suggested. I also left out the bay leaves because my husband doesn’t like them. The next time I make this I would use half as much Italian seasoning as it calls for because the seasoning was a little overwhelming. You definitely want to add at least some salt to the dish to reduce acidity.

I would give this 3.5 stars if I could. My husband really likes it and I think it is pretty good. I added more veggies~ mushrooms, a green pepper, black olives (I like my veggies). Also used whole wheat macaroni and subbed Worscestershire sauce (I didn't realize I was out of soy sauce until already being made). Forgiving recipe that you can easily tweak. Will make again, just not on a regular basis.
A little labor intensive, but yummy stuff!

Delish! Please people- don’t compare it to Hungarian Goulash. It’s not supposed to be! I use one cup beef broth and 2 cups water. I also mix 1 cup cheddar cheese in at the end and melt one cup mozzarella on top. You can’t go wrong with cheese! I leave out the soy but it can’t hurt... This reminds me of a weeknight staple growing up. Easy, economical, and everyone loves it!
Have made it several times, add green peppers but pretty much the same as recipe calls for. Everyone likes it.
Should taste great, but way too salty. Try it without the soy sauce and salt to taste.
Easy and delicious

My teens and I loved this comforting dish. I used stuff I had on hand which was nice. I also split the recipe in half but wish I hadn't only because leftovers would have been nice! Followed the steps and it worked out amazing, even timings were perfect. 
Thanks for posting this.
I followed the recipe, but added a green pepper, and did not use bay leaves. It turned out delicious! I will make this again!!
Excellent. Was a great choice for a cold, snowy day. Thanks for sharing!
I feel like it has too much Italian seasoning in. Felt too much like spaghetti!
I added a couple cloves garlic. This is good.

Substituted one of the onions for a green pepper, half the soy sauce for Worcestershire, omitted bay leave and Italian seasoning. Then substituted half the seasoning salt for Greek seasoning. Perfect.
Was terrific
A little salty. Will cut the soy sauce next time.
Great recipe, did not have a bay leaf but still turned out great! A must have is bread with peanut butter goes great together with this!
Loved it!!!

Delicious recipe! Easy, economical and very tasty. I cut the recipe in half because it's for my hubby and I. I did add a little brown sugar to cut the acid in the tomatoes and also added some salt and pepper.. I think next time I'll add some chopped green bell pepper. Thanks for the recipe! I will definitely make it again.
Turned out perfectly!
Add mushrooms. Yum!
Great taste. And very easy to make if your pressed for time..

I really loved it! So does my family. I did differ with some ingredients but I always use a base recipe then make it my own. I used all the ingredients it called for except instead of ground beef, I used ground Italian turkey, instead of cloves of garlic, I used minced garlic, I added corn and cayenne pepper to the mixture. I will be making this again!!!
Delicious. Made exactly as directed

This recipe was amazing; very simple to follow for someone whose not a good cook like myself and the flavour was amazing. I missed a few minor ingredients but it still tasted great. I am so happy to have stumbled on it and recommend it to any beginner cooks or anyone who wants a flavourful, hardy stew.
i made this recipe with my teenage son how easy good food can be to cook. He is delighted that you can make his this with things that are normally in the pantry. we added corn and green beans..

I've made goulash many times in the past but couldn't recall all the ingredients. I pulled up this recipe as a guide and used what I had available. I altered it by using 1 lb hamburger, 1 onion, and the last of my garden's green peppers. I also cooked the noodles in a separate pot and added after cooked. It turned out fantastic!
Very good base for exploration. Added mushrooms and kidney beans. This is a great cold-weather comfort dish.
I made the recipe as posted, but used twisty pasta, since I didn’t have elbows. Tasty recipe!
This was very good. I did substitute the tomato with 1 large can of Rotel, I added a green pepper as well. This was delicious. I have got rid of my old Goulash recipt.

Always looking for a new goulash recipe to try figured I’d give this one a shot with all the positive reviews. Well let me tell you folks if I could have had a real 5 star review I’d have given it a Big Fat 0! I followed the recipe to the T and it was the most bland disgusting goulash I’ve ever tasted I wouldn’t even feed this to my kids without adding brown sugar and ketchup just to make it edible, pretty sad when I doubt I’ll ever try to think out of the box ever again trying to make goulash besides the basic which the basic would have been gourmet over this.

Thank you for posting this recipe!!! My Grandma made something like this a few times and I never knew exactly what was in it or how she did it. I'll admit I do know she threw in leftover vegetables from the fridge and I may have thrown in some leftover grilled corn off the cob. But!!! I did taste the recipe as stated before the corn and it was delicious before and again after! Thank you!!!
Perfect for Sunday Football.. added extra garlic, onion and it’s perfect! Yum

Excellent starting point for this dish. Made some changes/additions: 
Added green pepper (needs 2), a teaspoon of red pepper chili flakes and a tablespoon of sugar. Instead of water I used beef bullion and Worcestershire sauce instead of soy sauce. 

We loved it. Great for leftovers too.
